info.collaboration_station.utilities

Class Printer

  • java.lang.Object
    • info.collaboration_station.utilities.Printer

  • public class Printer
extends java.lang.Object
    Use this to print to the terminal. Also backs up output to a log file.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  Printer.DefaultPrintStream
      Used to specify whether everything should be sent to standard output, everything should be sent to standard error, or only bad things/errors should be sent to standard error.
      protected static class  Printer.Package_Private_Methods
      Container for package private methods.
      static class  Printer.ReadoutCondition
      Used to specify whether something is being printed under an error situation (bad) or a non-error situation (good).
      static class  Printer.Significance
      Used to rank terminal readouts based on relative importance.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static java.lang.String ls
      The system independent line separator, shortened to two letters for convenience.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Printer()

      Prints out an exception formatted appropriately (the first numberOfRowsToDisplayInStackTraces_ lines of the stack trace with the point at which the exception is printed.).

      Prints something that is good or that was supposed to happen.

    • Field Detail

      • ls

        public static final java.lang.String ls
        The system independent line separator, shortened to two letters for convenience.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Printer

        public Printer()

    • Method Detail

      • getNumberOfRowsInStackTraces

        public static int getNumberOfRowsInStackTraces()
        Returns:
        the number of stack trace rows to be displayed in the terminal.

      • setNumberOfRowsInStackTraces

        public static void setNumberOfRowsInStackTraces(int numRows)
        Parameters:
        numRows - the number of stack trace rows that you would like to see in the terminal when you print out a stack trace. Although not all rows will appear in the terminal, by default they be sent to the log file.

      • isClosed

        public static boolean isClosed()
        Returns:
        true is this printer was closed, false otherwise.

      • getPrintToLogFile

        public static boolean getPrintToLogFile()
        Gets the variable printToLogFile_.
        Returns:
        true if log file printing is on, false otherwise.

      • setPrintToLogFile

        public static void setPrintToLogFile(boolean useLogFile)
        Determines whether or not the log file should be printed to.
        Parameters:
        useLogFile - true for printing to the log file and false for no printing to the log file.

      • getPrintToTerminal

        public static boolean getPrintToTerminal()
        Gets the variable printToTerminal_
        Returns:
        true if terminal printing is on, false otherwise.

      • setPrintToTerminal

        public static void setPrintToTerminal(boolean toPrint)
        Determines whether of not the terminal should be printed to.
        Parameters:
        toPrint - true for printing to the terminal or false for no printing to the terminal.

      • getMyOutputSignificanceLevel

        public static Printer.Significance getMyOutputSignificanceLevel()
        Gets the variable mySignificanceLevel_
        Returns:
        The significance level below which no terminal output will be displayed.

      • setMyOutputSignificanceLevel

        public static void setMyOutputSignificanceLevel(Printer.Significance level)
        Sets the variable mySignificanceLevel_
        Parameters:
        level - all messages that are at this significance level or higher are printed. Messages that are below (less important than) this significance level are not printed.

      • getMyDefaultPrintStream

        public static Printer.DefaultPrintStream getMyDefaultPrintStream()
        Gets the variable myTargetPrintStream_

      • setMyDefaultPrintStream

        public static void setMyDefaultPrintStream(Printer.DefaultPrintStream streamType)
        All terminal error messages will go through this DefaultPrintStream.

      • getLogFileNameOrEmptyString

        public static java.lang.String getLogFileNameOrEmptyString()
        Returns:
        Either the name of the log file or empty string if the log file was not successfully created.

      • close

        public static void close()
        Closes the Printer (which you should do just before application termination). After closing the printer, it should not be used. Does nothing if called repeatedly.

      • printLineToReadout

        public static void printLineToReadout(java.lang.String message,
                                      Printer.ReadoutCondition condition,
                                      Printer.Significance severity)
        This print statement does not include a stack trace, but it does append a newline.
        See Also:
        printToReadout(java.lang.String, info.collaboration_station.utilities.Printer.ReadoutCondition, info.collaboration_station.utilities.Printer.Significance)

      • printToReadout

        public static void printToReadout(java.lang.String message,
                                  Printer.ReadoutCondition condition,
                                  Printer.Significance severity)
        Meant to be used by other print statements internally, this print statement does not include a stack trace.
        Parameters:
        message - the message to be printed
        condition - whether the message is an error or non-error message

      • printSlightlyGood

        public static void printSlightlyGood(java.lang.String message)
        Informs about something that is not very significant or important, but that isn't bad.

      • printGood

        public static void printGood(java.lang.String message)
        Prints something that is good or that was supposed to happen.
        Parameters:
        message - the message to be printed as if it were a regular non-error message.

      • printVeryGood

        public static void printVeryGood(java.lang.String message)
        Informs about an usual or special occurrence or event with significant effect on code flow. Not for errors.

      • printSlightlyBad

        public static void printSlightlyBad(java.lang.String message)
        Notifies about inconveniences or non-positive mundane occurrences. Can also be used for things that we don't care to read, like the last 20 lines of a 200 line stack trace.
        Parameters:
        message - the message to be printed.

      • printBad

        public static void printBad(java.lang.String message)
        Notified about potential threats or negative occurrences. Not meant for fatal errors.
        Parameters:
        message - the message to be printed.

      • printVeryBad

        public static void printVeryBad(java.lang.String message)
        Notifies about potentially fatal or highly unusual negative events.
        Parameters:
        message - the message to be printed.

      • printException

        public static void printException(java.lang.Throwable t)
        Prints out an exception formatted appropriately (the first numberOfRowsToDisplayInStackTraces_ lines of the stack trace with the point at which the exception is printed.).
        Parameters:
        t - Exception or error to be printed as an error.

      • printException

        public static void printException(java.lang.String message,
                                  java.lang.Throwable t)
        Prints out a message and a stack trace caused by a throwable as an error. Message cannot be null.
        Parameters:
        message - message to be printed (cannot be null)
        t - throwable that caused the message to be printed
